intro: Rhinanthus alectorolophus subsp. kerneri, commonly known as the Kern's yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in spikes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heaths, often growing in association with other wildflowers. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in suitable environments.
